intro.headline: Recycling on-the-go
intro.description:
[\#LeedsByExample on-the-go recycling](https://www.zerowasteleeds.org.uk/tips/recycling-whilst-youre-out-and-about-in-leeds-city-centre/) is back! In lockdown we focused on [StayAtHome waste reduction](https://www.zerowasteleeds.org.uk/posts/how-can-we-build-back-better-together/) but as the city starts to open up again, we're back promoting and sharing the benefits of recycling coffee cups, cans and plastic bottles.  

When it comes to on-the-go recycling [Leeds truly leads the way](https://www.zerowasteleeds.org.uk/posts/leedsbyexample-on-the-go-recycling/), recycling rates tripled from 17% to 49% and it is being rolled out to other cities across the UK.  We'll be building on that success, as well as adapting our work to reflect the times by providing practical support to people and businesses to help them waste less.   

Look out for regular updates on our [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/zerowasteleeds/), [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ZeroWasteLeeds) and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zerowasteleeds/).

projects.title: Zero Waste Fashion
projects.description: We launched Zero Waste Fashion to help make it easier for people to recycle, reuse, repair and upcycle clothing and textiles in our city.  We want to reduce the amount of clothing that ends of up in household bins - currently 4000 tonnes per year!  Take a look at our map of all the textile banks, charity shops, repair shops, sewing classes and clothes exchanges in Leeds.
